an5.163:1.1: There Venerable Sāriputta addressed the mendicants:
an5.163:2.1: “A mendicant with five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.
an5.163:2.3: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in ethics.
an5.163:2.7: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
an5.163:2.8: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.”
